entries.content: Starting file monitor fix session. Error: jobManager.listJobs is not a function. Root cause appears to be incorrect module path in DependencyContainer - looking for '../../../file-watcher/JobManager' which doesn't exist. Need to find actual JobManager location and fix the dependency injection.

Found the issue: FileMonitorMessageHandler expects JobManager with listJobs() method, but JobManager doesn't exist in codebase. The DependencyContainer tries to require('../../../file-watcher/JobManager') from dist, but this file was never created. Need to either: 1) Create JobManager implementation, or 2) Modify FileMonitorMessageHandler to work without JobManager.

Decision: Will create JobManager, JobConfigService, and ScriptExecutor classes from scratch based on the interface requirements found in FileMonitorMessageHandler. The handler expects: listJobs(), getJob(id), createJob(job), deleteJob(id), toggleJob(id), and initialize(context) methods.
